alert.note: Alert for Greenwood (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 1:06AM EDT until June 27 at 9:30AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Greenwood County in upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 AM EDT, The threat of additional showers has ended for the time being, and streamgauges in the region were showing water levels beginning to fall. Lingering areas of high water and any lowland flooding will also gradually improve as well overnight. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will expire on schedule. - Some locations that may experience lingering flooding include... Greenwood, Ninety Six, Cokesbury, Troy, Ninety Six Historic Site, Lake Greenwood, Greenwood State Park, Promised Land, Bradley, Coronaca, Epworth, Kirksey, Callison and Dyson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
